info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 16 at 2:14PM MDT until further notice by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Lodge Creek near International Border affecting Blaine and Hill Counties. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack and increase river flows. For the Lodge Creek...including International Border...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and is forecast. * WHERE...Lodge Creek near International Border. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.3 feet, April 24 2018 - No impacts were reported, yet areal flooding did occur because of snowmelt in northern Hill and northern Blaine counties. The gauge is actually in southern Alberta. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:25 PM MDT Sunday the stage was 7.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate above flood stage with a maximum value of 9.1 feet Tuesday morning. It is forecast to fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.1 feet on 04/08/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Lodge Creek International Borde 7.0 7.8 Sun 1 pm MDT 8.1 8.4 8.0 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 900 PM MDT.
